# UITableViewDropCoordinator

**Protocol**

An interface for coordinating your custom drop-related actions with the table view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor protocol UITableViewDropCoordinator : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview

Don’t create instances of this class yourself. When a drop occurs in the table view, UIKit creates an instance of this class and passes it to your [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewDropDelegate/tableView(_:performDropWith:)] method. Use the object to let the table view know how you want to animate the dropped items into position.

## Getting the dragged items

- **items**: The items being dragged.

## Getting the drop location

- **destinationIndexPath**: The index path at which to insert the item into the table view.

## Animating rows to their destination

- **drop(_:toRowAt:)**: Animates the item to the specified index path in the table view.
- **drop(_:intoRowAt:rect:)**
- **drop(_:to:)**: Animates the item to an arbitrary location in your view hierarchy.
- **drop(_:to:)**: Animates the item to the specified location and inserts a placeholder cell at that location.

## Getting the session information

- **session**: The drop session containing information about the transaction.
- **proposal**: The proposal for how to incorporate the dropped items.

## Drag and drop

- **Supporting drag and drop in table views**: Initiate drags and handle drops from a table view.
- **Adopting drag and drop in a table view**: Demonstrates how to enable and implement drag and drop for a table view.
- **UITableViewDragDelegate**: The interface for initiating drags from a table view.
- **UITableViewDropDelegate**: The interface for handling drops in a table view.
- **UITableViewDropItem**: The data associated with an item being dropped into the table view.
- **UITableViewDropProposal**: Your proposed solution for handling a drop in a table view.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol
